title: Accuracy, robustness and cybersecurity for high-risk AI systems

article_refs.quote: High-risk AI systems shall be designed and developed in such a way that they achieve an appropriate level of accuracy, robustness, and cybersecurity, and that they perform consistently in those respects throughout their lifecycle.

legal_consequence.verbatim: High-risk AI systems shall be designed and developed in such a way that they achieve an appropriate level of accuracy, robustness, and cybersecurity, and that they perform consistently in those respects throughout their lifecycle.

items.label: Declaration of accuracy and metrics
items.text: The levels of accuracy and relevant accuracy metrics shall be declared in the instructions for use.

items.label: Resilience and mitigation
items.text: Systems shall be resilient to errors/faults/inconsistencies, with technical/organisational measures such as redundancy; address feedback loops for systems continuing to learn; resilient against adversarial attempts to alter use, outputs or performance.

items.label: Benchmarks and measurement methodologies
items.text: The Commission encourages development of benchmarks and measurement methodologies for performance metrics.

items.label: Penalty and enforcement (Article 99)
items.text: Obligation/requirement. Administrative fines up to EUR 15,000,000 or 3% of worldwide turnover (whichever is higher) may apply for nonâ€‘compliance (subject to SME caps and due process).
